intro: Henriettella lundellii, commonly known as the Lundell's henriettella, is a flowering plant native to the high Andes of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheat and related species. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, often pink or red flowers. Henriettella lundellii typically thrives in cool, moist environments at high altitudes. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
